creator: sdoyle@gmail.com
text:
If a jsp has a page directive of the following form
<%@ page contentType="application/x-java-jnlp-file" %> 
then all request.getParameter() calls return null. Other calls to request (like request.getMethod() ) work correctly.

Example URL: 

http://localhost:8090/DDL/app/ddl.jsp?DICOMRemoteAETitle=Remote&DICOMRemoteDicomPort=3001&DICOMRemoteHost=radworkstation.hospital.edu&DICOMLocalAETitle=MCDICOM&DICOMLocalDicomPort=3002

The request.getMethod() correctly returns GET.

If I leave out the page directive the request.getParameter() methods return correct values.

When I look at the generated Java code - the only difference is in the call to setContentType()

<       response.setContentType("application/x-java-jnlp-file");
---
>       response.setContentType("text/html");

So - it's something happening at runtime. Shouldn't all GET methods have request.getParameter() treated identically no matter what the output contentType is?

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
This works for me. There would appear to be some other issue at play.

Please use the users list to help you debug this issue.
